abstract.para: &dapsacr; (DocBook Authoring and Publishing Suite) is a programm that transforms your XML document into a text, HTML, PDF, EPUB or manpages. It is the successor of the former susedoc package.The following article shows you the basics of daps. If you want to see more options and functions, enter the command: daps --help

sect1.title: Target Audience
sect1.para: This quick start is for advanced users.Before you start, you need:

listitem.para: A SUSE Linux system
A Directory Structure
ENV-files (as shown in section 4)
Some experience with SUSE Linux
Some knowledge about XML
Experienced user with commandline knowledge
Some expierence with DocBook

sect1.title: Terminology
sect1.para: The following terms are used in this article:

listitem.para: DocBook is a semantic markup language for technical documentation published as a DTD.
DTD (Document type definition) defines exactly the elements, entities attributes and structure in a XML or HTML document.
Is the process of converting a XSL-FO file into PDF with the help of a FO formatter.
Renders XSL-FO documents usually into PDF. The output formats depends on the formatter.For example FOP and XEP
FOP (Formatting Objects Processor) converts XSL-FO in to printable formats.

Data transformation converts data from source data format into a destination data for example. Is the process of converting the XML document into a target format, for example HTML. This process uses the XSLT stylesheet with the assistance of an XSLT processor.
Validation is a control process for XML documents by using a DTD.
XSL-FO or Extensible Stylesheet Language-Formatting Objects is a markup language to generate PDFs with XML documents.
XSLT or Extensible Stylesheet Language for Transformations is a language based on XML and it is used for transformation of XML documents
XML (extensible markup language) is a language with rules to encode documents into machine-readable form.
